title: Seasons 19 Crop Rotation Planner How To

tasks.task: Navigating the Crop Rotation Planner in Farming Simulator 19
subtasks: Understanding the historical crop data for fields
Manually entering crop history for the past two years
Selecting crops for the current year to maximize percentage yield
Planning crops for subsequent years to optimize rotation
Shifting planner entries upward periodically to accommodate new crop plans
Adapting the planner process for different game seasons (e.g., checking historical data in winter, adjusting plans annually)

tasks.task: Setting up a spread sheet for crop rotation planning
subtasks: Creating a vertical plan view, from top to bottom, for each field
Entering the oldest available crop data (two years prior) for each field
Keying in the most recent crop data (current year's stubble) for each field
Using percentage yield indicators to choose optimal crops for the next planting seasons
Rotating crop types across fields to maximize long-term yields and soil health

tasks.task: Correcting potential inaccuracies or limitations in the planner methods
subtasks: Recognizing personal gaming experience may not fully align with official game features
Considering possible conflicts between the spreadsheet method and actual game mechanics
Seeking validation from PC users to confirm the effectiveness of the proposed strategy
Adapting methods for different game versions (PlayStation 4 vs PC) with potential feature discrepancies
